reviews.text: I'm sure I'm not alone in valuing Tripadvisor when planning my trip. I literrally read every review trying to find a hotel in San Francisco and struggled to work out the best location to stay. Tripadvisor seemed to say Union Sq was 'the heart' of San Fran but I found it just full of shops and I wasn't really in the mood for shopping. Fisherman's wharf is very very touristy... the kind of place kids would love with candy floss and balloon sellers at every corner - it's the only place I actually felt like a tourist.
reviews.title: What a bargain, excellent value and the best place to stay in San Fran!

reviews.text: A friend who used to live in San Francisco said to stay in Marina district or Pacific Heights for alternative, cool places which were safe and had nice restaurants, boutiques etc. He was definitely right! After getting the airport shuttle and driving through Downtown (where I saw lots of collapsed drunk bodies laying on the pavement) it was a relief to arrive in this safe neightbourhood. The architecture was great with beautiful and very different houses lining every street.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, safe neighborhood...

reviews.text: After an easy check in at about 7pm I was determined to see the Golden Gate Bridge and luckily this was possible with less than a 5 minute walk from Marina Inn. It is so close to water it is like a breath of fresh air! That wouldn't be possible or easy staying downtown! I sat and watched sunset and local joggers around the bridge. It also meant that (with my jet lag) once up early the next morning I got to the bridge before any tourists.
reviews.title: Tough to beat the value at this hotel

reviews.text: I walked everywhere but my legs ached at the end of each day... but it is possible from Marina Inn to walk to the bridge (and over and back again!), then Fishermans wharf, Embarcadero and town. Then I walked through China Town, North Beach and Lombard st... and ended up on Crooked street - great. It's hilly but that gives great views!
reviews.title: bed bugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was so much better than I expected. A large double with clean bathroom and a good shower. TV and a fridge were unexpected bonuses. But the first night I was in a room facing Lombard st and it was quite noisy (I live on a very quiet st). THe next morning I asked reception if there were any other free rooms and they kindly transferred me to one of the interior rooms which was just as great but much much quieter!
reviews.title: Clean, value for money hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful old inn, felt like being in a B & B, with complimentary continental breakfast. Good location on Lombard St. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, but noisy from street traffic, no A/C.
reviews.title: Great Value for San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Marina Inn and again - we were happy to stay there.
reviews.title: Great location and great service

reviews.text: The Marina Inn is a well priced, nice little hotel in the Marina District. You can easily get to downtown, the piers and other nice places. There are a lot of restaurants and bars just a short walk away. The front desk was always helpful (thank you so much Yolanda - you made our stay great again) and made really good recommendations on food and trips. The rooms are small but ok - if you go to SF you just need a bed to sleep and that is what is offered. For breakfast - ok - continental breakfast in the US means you have to find a nicer place but there are good opportunities around the Marina Inn. To be true - of course there are some "negative" things: The rooms are not always so clean (but give the usual tip to the chambermaid and it will get better) and the Lombard street is really loud. Hence, you should try to get a room that is not located on first or second floor. The breakfast is not so amazing but most hotels in the US do not have a real breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location and value in SFO!

reviews.text: Overall, because of the great people in this hotel, the fantastic location and the "ok" rooms we will definitely come back. We love this city and enjoyed our stay there once again.
reviews.title: Good location, but go there without a car
Stuffed room, not comfortable, but great location
reviews.text: I must give the Marina Inn 5 stars because to find a clean, safe, AFFORDABLE place like this in SFO was a Godsend. The Marina Inn was offered as part of a package I booked on Priceline that included airfare from L.A. with 3 nights for only $275!!. Unbelievable. I checked the reviews on Trip Advisor and Yelp and was satisfied that I'd be happy. And I was! I've found that rooms this affordable generally do not come with a TV or private bath, so was very pleased to have found this place.

This hotel may be attractive because of its location and relatively cheap rates. The room I was given was large, with a nice bathroom. But it gets hot during the day, and the fan was not doing much of a difference either. The TV is inside the wardrobe. The reception is very simple, with not so friendly receptionists. There is a space to leave your luggage on check-out but it is not particularly safe. The breakfast is included in the rate, but it is not much of a breakfast. Only banana muffins and orrange juice. The muffins were very good though. There is a vending machine on teh ground floor and a coffee place nextdoor. Free wifi is advertised, but I was not able to connect to it, the signal was very poor. As for the location itself, it is seemed pretty safe, even at night. There are several bus stops nearby, and the cable is not too far either. Overall, it is a nice neat not too expensive hotel ideal for budget travellers.
reviews.title: Ideal for budget travellers

reviews.text: I stayed at the Marina Inn in the first week of June 2010 and found it to be very pleasant. I stayed in deluxe room. My room was always clean and amenities are more than adequate. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to fisherman’s wharf area from the hotel (I am a quick walker so others may take a little longer). You can always jump on the MUNI at the corner to get anywhere in the city. If you are a stranger to the city as I was, the blocks are very small so it is very close to the MUNI stop into the city (less than 50 metres). As an alternative to the touristy Fisherman’s Wharf, a short distance toward the bridge there are plenty of restaurants and bars. The hotel is in a great location
reviews.title: Very good value in great location

reviews.text: Breakfast at the hotel consisted of tea/coffee, Muffins and hard boiled eggs. Nothing too flash but was a good start to the day.
reviews.title: A decent stay in Downtown !

reviews.text: I was on the 3rd floor and the free wifi didn’t want to work there. However taking my laptop to the foyer or 2nd floor lounge I was able to access internet for e-mail etc.
reviews.title: Charming, with friendly very helpful staff

reviews.text: When I was researching San Francisco I found a lot of pretty expensive hotels on offer. I have no doubt that most of these are much flasher. However I do not hesitate to recommend the Marina Inn for value for money and a great location.
reviews.title: Great value, very clean, and good free breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived early to be greeted rudely by the receptionist. We were told we could leave our bags around the corner by the office untill check in time, the receptionist didn't bother to check if the room was ready. Came back she still wasn't friendly. Room was tidy, cute bay windows. Bed was squeaky so were the neighbours as you could hear them through the walls. We were put in the room above a hair salon which also provided more noise. Breakfast was provided which is good if you can stand banana walnut muffins, porridge and boiled eggs every day. No microwaves or fridges in the rooms. At checkout we discovered the recptionist was missing she eventually came back in from her cigarette break with a very odd herb smell lingering on her.
reviews.title: Nice but noisy and basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This “hotel” has it all—bedbugs (room 412), a fitfully -spitting shower head, cracked sink, and stopped-up bathtub drain (room 405), a hoodie-wearing surly lad behind the front desk, and customer service that will make your jaw drop in amazement!
reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend to worst enemy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here’s an example of what you can expect. You turn down the bed and find some blood-engorged insects frolicking away. You call the front desk and report your discovery. You won’t hear anything like, “Oh, we’re sorry.” Or, “Can we help move you to another room?” Or, “That’s terrible!” No, the clerk says: “What do you want to do?”
reviews.title: Better than expected
Convenient
reviews.text: You say, “We want to move out of this room!” The desk says, “Well…okay. Come down and get a key. But all we have is a room in the back, on an alley overlooking a neighbor’s kitchen.”
So you move your stuff and, since it’s too late to find another hotel, hope to sleep in peace.
reviews.title: Much better than I thought for a 1-star hotel!
